intro: Peucedanum graveolens, commonly known as cow parsley or wild carrot, is a biennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its seeds are small, dry, and often used in culinary and medicinal applications. The entire plant has a mild, carroty aroma due to the presence of volatile oils.
